page.title: 16Place Names
page.content: Mr Allen White,a local historian,has carried out research about Mudeford and Stanpit.The earliest record of the area was in the original Domesday Survey when 2 manors are mentioned, both called Stanpeta.The population was estimated to be 30.The census in 1871 gives the population as 211 males and 259 females. The name 'Stanpit' means stony pit.The name Mudeford is thought to originate from'muddy ford'(first reference 1270) and not from Mude stream which did not receive its name until much later. Mudeford became popular for sea bathing during C18.Adverts in Salisbury Journal 1788,1792 bear this out.Two visits of Goerge111 to a local villa(Sandhills)must have helped.Attempts to change the name to Sandford(Mud image being considered inappropriate)were not successful.
